00095 /// This resizing is still not working right! The secondary tabs are not properly resizing!!!
00096 void TMainDisplayWindow::ResetSize(){  
00097 
00098   // Resize each part of the tab.
00099   for(int itab = 0; itab < fTab->GetNumberOfTabs() ; itab++){    
00100 
00101     TGCompositeFrame* frame = fTab->GetTabContainer(itab);
00102 
00103     // This is awkward.  Each composite frame actually has a bunch of elements.
00104     // Try to resize all the elements that are TGFrameElements. 
00105     // This seems to work if the added frame is a TRootEmbeddedCanvas; not sure 
00106     // otherwise.
00107     TList* mylist = frame->GetList();
00108     
00109     TIter next(mylist);
00110     while (TObject *obj = next()){
00111 
00112       
00113       TGFrameElement *frame_element = dynamic_cast<TGFrameElement*>(obj);
00114 
00115       if(frame_element){
00116         frame_element->fFrame->Resize((frame_element->fFrame->GetDefaultSize().fWidth)
00117                                       *(fMain->GetSize().fWidth)/(fMain->GetDefaultSize().fWidth),
00118                                       (frame_element->fFrame->GetDefaultSize().fHeight)
00119                                       *(fMain->GetSize().fHeight)/(fMain->GetDefaultSize().fHeight));
00120 
00121         //std::cout << "Frame " << frame_element->fFrame->GetDefaultSize().fWidth << " " << fMain->GetSize().fWidth << " " 
00122         //        << fMain->GetDefaultSize().fWidth << " " << frame_element->fFrame->GetDefaultSize().fHeight << " " 
00123         //        << fMain->GetSize().fHeight << " " << fMain->GetDefaultSize().fHeight << std::endl;
00124       }else
00125         std::cout << "TMainDisplayWindow::ResetSize::  Dynamic cast of obj to TGFrameElement failed." << std::endl;
00126     }
00127   }
00128 
00129 }

00131 void TMainDisplayWindow::AddCanvas(std::string name){
00132 
00133   // Add a new tab element, of type TGCompositeFrame
00134   TGCompositeFrame *compositeFrame = fTab->AddTab(name.c_str());
00135   compositeFrame->SetLayoutManager(new TGVerticalLayout(compositeFrame));
00136 
00137   // Add a canvas within that composite frame.
00138   char cname[500];
00139   sprintf(cname,"Canvas_%i",fTab->GetNumberOfTabs() - 1);
00140   TRootEmbeddedCanvas *embed_canvas  = new TRootEmbeddedCanvas(cname, compositeFrame,fDefaultWidth,fDefaultHeight);
00141   compositeFrame->AddFrame(embed_canvas, new TGLayoutHints(kLHintsTop | kLHintsExpandX,5,5,5,0));
00142 
00143 }

00146 void TMainDisplayWindow::BuildWindow(){
00147 
00148   fMain->MapSubwindows();
00149   // Initialize the layout algorithm
00150   fMain->Resize(fMain->GetDefaultSize());
00151   // Map main frame
00152   fMain->MapWindow();
00153 
00154 
00155 }

00157 /// Pull the embedded canvas out of the compositeframe.
00158 TRootEmbeddedCanvas* GetTRootEmbeddedCanvasFromTGCompositeFrame(TGCompositeFrame* frame){
00159 
00160   if(!frame) return 0;
00161   
00162   TList* mylist = frame->GetList();
00163   
00164   TIter next(mylist);
00165   while (TObject *obj = next()){
00166     
00167     TGFrameElement *frame_element = dynamic_cast<TGFrameElement*>(obj);
00168     
00169     if(frame_element){
00170       
00171       TGFrame* frame = frame_element->fFrame;
00172       TRootEmbeddedCanvas *embed_canvas = dynamic_cast<TRootEmbeddedCanvas*>(frame);
00173 
00174       if(embed_canvas){
00175         return embed_canvas;
00176       }
00177     }    
00178   }
00179   
00180   return 0;
00181 
00182 }

00185 TRootEmbeddedCanvas* TMainDisplayWindow::GetEmbeddedCanvas(int iTab){
00186 
00187   TGCompositeFrame* frame = fTab->GetTabContainer(iTab);
00188   return GetTRootEmbeddedCanvasFromTGCompositeFrame(frame);
00189 
00190 }

00192 
00193 TRootEmbeddedCanvas* TMainDisplayWindow::GetEmbeddedCanvas(const char *name){
00194 
00195   // First find which tab has this name.  This is awkward because the 
00196   // TGCompositeFrame doesn't actully store the name; only the tab element does.
00197 
00198   TIter nextTab(fTab->GetList());
00199   nextTab();  // Skip the first element.  This is the overall TGCompositeFrame, not the tabbed one.
00200 
00201   TGFrameElement *el;
00202   TGTabElement *tab = 0;
00203   TGCompositeFrame *comp = 0;
00204   while ((el = (TGFrameElement *) nextTab())) {
00205     tab  = (TGTabElement *) el->fFrame;
00206     el   = (TGFrameElement *) nextTab();
00207     if (*tab->GetText() == name){
00208       comp = (TGCompositeFrame *) el->fFrame;
00209     }
00210   }
00211 
00212   // Now return the embedded canvas
00213   return GetTRootEmbeddedCanvasFromTGCompositeFrame(comp);
00214 
00215 }

00218 TCanvas* TMainDisplayWindow::GetCanvas(int iTab){
00219   TRootEmbeddedCanvas* embed = GetEmbeddedCanvas(iTab);
00220   if(embed) return embed->GetCanvas();
00221   
00222   return 0;
00223 }

00225 TCanvas* TMainDisplayWindow::GetCanvas(const char *name){
00226   TRootEmbeddedCanvas* embed = GetEmbeddedCanvas(name);
00227   if(embed) return embed->GetCanvas();
00228   
00229   return 0;

00232 std::string TMainDisplayWindow::GetCurrentTabName(){
00233 
00234   TIter nextTab(fTab->GetList());
00235   nextTab();  // Skip the first element.  This is the overall TGCompositeFrame, not the tabbed one.
00236 
00237   // Get the index for the current canvas
00238   int index = fTab->GetCurrent();
00239   TGFrameElement *el;
00240   TGTabElement *tab = 0;
00241   TGCompositeFrame *comp = 0;
00242 
00243   // Loop over the number of tabs, until we find the right one.
00244   for(int i = 0; i <= index; i++){
00245     el = (TGFrameElement *) nextTab();
00246     tab  = (TGTabElement *) el->fFrame;
00247     el   = (TGFrameElement *) nextTab();
00248     comp = (TGCompositeFrame *) el->fFrame;
00249   }
00250   if(tab){
00251     return std::string(*tab->GetText());
00252   }
00253 
00254   return std::string("not found");
00255 }

00274                             "JPG files",     "*.jpg",
00275                             "EPS files",   "*.eps",
00276                             0,               0 };

00278 void TMainDisplayWindow::SavePadButtonAction(){
00279   static TString dir(".");
00280   TGFileInfo fi;
00281   fi.fFileTypes = filetypes;
00282   fi.fIniDir    = StrDup(dir);
00283   new TGFileDialog(gClient->GetRoot(), fMain, kFDSave, &fi);
00284   printf("Open file: %s (dir: %s)\n", fi.fFilename,
00285          fi.fIniDir);
00286 
00287   // Resize pad while saving; to get good image resolution.fTab
00288   double xl = gPad->GetXlowNDC(), xh = gPad->GetXlowNDC() + gPad->GetWNDC();
00289   double yl = gPad->GetYlowNDC(), yh = gPad->GetYlowNDC() + gPad->GetHNDC();
00290 
00291   gPad->SetPad(0,0,1.0,1.0);
00292   gPad->SaveAs(fi.fFilename);
00293   gPad->SetPad(xl,yl,xh,yh);
00294   gPad->Update();
00295   
00296 }

00312 void TMainDisplayWindow::PauseResumeButtonAction(){
00313 
00314   if(fProcessingPaused){
00315     fProcessingPaused = false;
00316     fPauseButton->SetText("Pause");
00317     fSavePadButton->SetEnabled(false);
00318     fSaveCanvasButton->SetEnabled(false);
00319   }else{
00320     fProcessingPaused = true;
00321     fPauseButton->SetText("Resume");
00322     fSavePadButton->SetEnabled(true);
00323     fSaveCanvasButton->SetEnabled(true);
00324   }
00325 }
